page.title: 08BUILDINGS
page.content: The oldest and most interesting buildings in this block are the church of St.Augustine,Westbury its old vicarage, original farm houses and Westbury Manor which exhibits features from various phases over the last 250 years.The local oolitic limestone has been used to good effect in many of the old buildings.Those in the village used to have thatched roofs but only 2 now remain.The church dates from Norman times but additions and alterations have been made up to the last century.The Manor is now a school but fine plastered ceilings and other architectural features can still be seen.Westbury mill last ground corn in the 1920's using a mixture of water and steam power.It has now been converted to a variety of craft, retail and residential uses.
